trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a **calendar date picker** to let a user pick a single date from a contextual calendar view.
trans-unit.target: Use a **calendar date picker** to let a user pick a single date from a contextual calendar view.

trans-unit.source: Use it for things like choosing an appointment or departure date.
trans-unit.target: Use it for things like choosing an appointment or departure date.

trans-unit.source: To let a user pick a known date, such as a date of birth, where the context of the calendar is not important, consider using a [**date picker**](date-picker.md).
trans-unit.target: To let a user pick a known date, such as a date of birth, where the context of the calendar is not important, consider using a [**date picker**](date-picker.md).

trans-unit.source: For more info about choosing the right control, see the [Date and time controls](date-and-time.md) article.

trans-unit.source: The calendar date picker has an internal [**CalendarView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.aspx) for picking a date.
trans-unit.target: The calendar date picker has an internal [**CalendarView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.aspx) for picking a date.

trans-unit.source: A subset of CalendarView properties, like [**IsTodayHighlighted**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.istodayhighlighted.aspx) and [**FirstDayOfWeek**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.firstdayofweek.aspx), exist on CalendarDatePicker and are forwarded to the internal CalendarView to let you modify it.
trans-unit.target: A subset of CalendarView properties, like [**IsTodayHighlighted**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.istodayhighlighted.aspx) and [**FirstDayOfWeek**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.firstdayofweek.aspx), exist on CalendarDatePicker and are forwarded to the internal CalendarView to let you modify it.

trans-unit.source: However, you can't change the [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selectionmode.aspx) of the internal CalendarView to allow multiple selection.
trans-unit.target: However, you can't change the [**SelectionMode**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendarview.selectionmode.aspx) of the internal CalendarView to allow multiple selection.

trans-unit.source: If you need to let a user pick multiple dates or need a calendar to be always visible, consider using a calendar view instead of a calendar date picker.
trans-unit.target: If you need to let a user pick multiple dates or need a calendar to be always visible, consider using a calendar view instead of a calendar date picker.

trans-unit.source: See the [Calendar view](calendar-view.md) article for more info on how you can modify the calendar display.
trans-unit.target: See the [Calendar view](calendar-view.md) article for more info on how you can modify the calendar display.

trans-unit.source: Selecting dates
trans-unit.target: Selecting dates

trans-unit.source: Use the [**Date**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.date.aspx) property to get or set the selected date.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**Date**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.date.aspx) property to get or set the selected date.

trans-unit.source: By default, the Date property is **null**.
trans-unit.target: By default, the Date property is **null**.

trans-unit.source: When a user selects a date in the calendar view, this property is updated.
trans-unit.target: When a user selects a date in the calendar view, this property is updated.

trans-unit.source: A user can clear the date by clicking the selected date in the calendar view to deselect it.
trans-unit.target: A user can clear the date by clicking the selected date in the calendar view to deselect it.

trans-unit.source: When you set the Date in code, the value is constrained by the [**MinDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.mindate.aspx) and [**MaxDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.maxdate.aspx) properties.
trans-unit.target: When you set the Date in code, the value is constrained by the [**MinDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.mindate.aspx) and [**MaxDate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.maxdate.aspx) properties.

trans-unit.source: If **Date** is smaller than **MinDate**, the value is set to **MinDate**.
trans-unit.target: If **Date** is smaller than **MinDate**, the value is set to **MinDate**.

trans-unit.source: If **Date** is greater than **MaxDate**, the value is set to **MaxDate**.
trans-unit.target: If **Date** is greater than **MaxDate**, the value is set to **MaxDate**.

trans-unit.source: You can handle the [**DateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.datechanged.aspx) event to be notified when the Date value has changed.
trans-unit.target: You can handle the [**DateChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.datechanged.aspx) event to be notified when the Date value has changed.

trans-unit.source: Setting a header and placeholder text
trans-unit.target: Setting a header and placeholder text

trans-unit.source: You can add a [**Header**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.header.aspx) (or label) and [**PlaceholderText**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.placeholdertext.aspx) (or watermark) to the calendar date picker to give the user an indication of what it's used for.
trans-unit.target: You can add a [**Header**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.header.aspx) (or label) and [**PlaceholderText**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.placeholdertext.aspx) (or watermark) to the calendar date picker to give the user an indication of what it's used for.

trans-unit.source: To customize the look of the header, you can set the [**HeaderTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.headertemplate.aspx) property instead of Header.
trans-unit.target: To customize the look of the header, you can set the [**HeaderTemplate**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.calendardatepicker.headertemplate.aspx) property instead of Header.
